availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Abraham B. Cole (Webster County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy L. Cole. Father of Mary J. Cole, Sylvester Cole, and Allace Cole. Farmer in Webster County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a private from September 13, 1862 to September 23, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 603.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, District 2, p. 178A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0088.
